title: Quotient Rule of Exponents
text: For any real number a and natural numbers $$m$$ and $$n$$, such that $$m>n$$, the quotient rule of exponents states that $$\frac{a^m}{a^n}=a^{m-n}$$
speech: For any real number a and natural numbers  m  and  n , such that  m is greater than n , the quotient rule of exponents states that  fraction, a to the m-th, over, a to the n-th,  is equal to, a raised to the m minus n power
pacedSpeech: For any real number a and natural numbers   m
, such that   m is greater than n
, the quotient rule of exponents states that   fraction, a to the m-th, over, a to the n-th,  is equal to, a raised to the m minus n power

title: Quotient Rule of Exponents
text: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression: $$\frac{-7z}{{\left(-7z\right)}^5}=\frac{-7z^1}{{\left(-7z\right)}^5}=-7z^{1-5}=-7z^{\left(-4\right)}$$
speech: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression:  fraction, negative 7 z, over, parentheses negative 7 z,  to the fifth,  is equal to fraction, negative 7 z to the first, over, parentheses negative 7 z,  to the fifth,  is equal to, negative 7, z raised to the 1 minus 5 power is equal to negative 7, z raised to the parentheses negative 4  power

title: Negative Exponent Rule
text: For any nonzero real number a and natural number $$n$$, the negative rule of exponents states that $$a -n=\frac{1}{a^n}$$
speech: For any nonzero real number a and natural number  n , the negative rule of exponents states that  a, minus n, is equal to, fraction, 1 over, a to the n-th,
pacedSpeech: For any nonzero real number a and natural number   n
, the negative rule of exponents states that   a, minus n, is equal to, fraction, 1 over, a to the n-th,
